  Source   Edit

Audio manager module. Soloud library is used for audio. In this module, AudioSample is a short "sound effect" audio source that is completely loaded into memory. On the other hand, AudioStream is a long audio source that is continuously read from file and is usually used as background music.

Imports

resources

Types

AudioManager = object
  soloud: ptr Soloud
  bgHandle: cuint
  sfxMixer: ptr Bus
  fadeSeconds: float
  masterVolume: float
  bgVolume: float
  sfxVolume: float
  loopingSfx: CritBitTree[cuint]
A main object of the audio manager   Source   Edit

Procs

proc fadeBackground(m: var AudioManager; audio: AudioStreamId) {.
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Switches the current background music to audio. If there was no music playing, it just starts audio. If audio is "", then it stops the current one. The background music volume is smoothly faded for 2 seconds before switching.   Source   Edit 
proc initAudioManager(): AudioManager {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates an audio manager and initializes the library   Source   Edit 
proc playSample(m: var AudioManager; audio: AudioSampleId; volume: float = 1;
                pan: float = 0) {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Plays a sample audio. You can also specify its volume (from 0 to 1) and pan (from -1 to 1)   Source   Edit 
proc playSampleLoop(m: var AudioManager; audio: AudioSampleId;
                    volume: float = 1; pan: float = 0) {....raises: [KeyError],
    tags: [].}

Plays a sample audio and loops it. You can also specify its volume (from 0 to 1) and pan (from -1 to 1)

proc stopSample(m: var AudioManager; audio: AudioSampleId) {....raises: [KeyError],
    tags: [].}

Stops a sample audio that was previously looping.
